page.title: 15ST. GEORGE'S CHURCH,ORLETON
page.content: We interviewed the vicar and this is what he told us about the church. The original church was built in{Saxon times and was made of wood, this eventually fell down. The next church on the site was a{Norman}one, some of the features of the Norman Church can still be seen. Todays{tower}is partly Norman.The next church,a bigger one, was built around the Norman church, and most of the earlier one was knocked down.The stonework for this church was brought from{Orleton {quarries.}Most of todays{roof timbers come from the old{Elizabethan {battleships.}The{font}is the original Norman one, it is a very important one and is included in any book about fonts.It has{nine raised figures around the outside. Nobody knows why there are nine figures.
